verb.description: Dip (bread or other food) into a drink or soup before eating it.
examples: she dunked a piece of bread into her coffee

verb.description: Score by shooting the ball down through the basket with the hands above the rim.

noun.description: A shot downward into the basket with the hands above the rim.

origin: Early 20th century: from Pennsylvanian German dunke dip, from German tunken dip or plunge.
